intro: Hieracium tenuiflorum, commonly known as slenderflower hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 centimeters, featuring basal leaves that are narrow and often hairy. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, producing bright yellow flowers that attract various pollinators. Hieracium tenuiflorum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed sites, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
